abstract.p: Lettrer by Joann Stolzar responds to June 15 article on library computerization; says despite many appeals of technology, she cherishes her memories of researching her first English term paper as high school junior in 1968

block.p: Call me nostalgic, but ''The Library as the Latest Web Venture'' (June 15) makes me cherish my memories of researching my first English term paper as a high school junior in 1968. Making the trip to the Columbia University library from Long Island, searching the card catalog, taking notes on index cards and poring over books and articles convinced me to major in English in college.

Call me nostalgic, but ''The Library as the Latest Web Venture'' (June 15) makes me cherish my memories of researching my first English term paper as a high school junior in 1968. Making the trip to the Columbia University library from Long Island, searching the card catalog, taking notes on index cards and poring over books and articles convinced me to major in English in college.

Yes, the technology of research online is fast and convenient, and the idea of not leaving your dorm room may appeal to some. But the pleasure of getting sidetracked in the stacks by an interesting book title or binding will be lost.
